page.title: 02Relief,works (1925)
page.content: NEWBRIDGE IN 1925 _________________ researched by Liane Davies Q.What was Newbridge like in 1925? The Newbridge area consisted of mainly terraced houses which were built for the miners families (who worked privately owned mines).Most houses consisted of two families,because there were not sufficient houses available.The area had a railway,poor roads,two colleries where most of the men in the area worked,and a canal system which was used for transporting coal from the colliery to Newport.Most of the families were very large in number and very poor financially and many children died young due to poverty and diseases.
